contentMetadata.content: {{Short description|Tanazanian investments company}} {{Infobox company | name = National Investments Company Limited (NICOL) Tanzania | logo = | logo_size = | logo_padding = | logo_alt = | logo_caption = | image = | image_size = | image_alt = | image_caption = | native_name = | native_name_lang = | former_name = National Investments Company (NICO) | type = Public | traded_as = {{DARSE|NICOL}} | industry = [[Investment fund]] | founded = 25 June 2003 | founder = | hq_location = | hq_location_city = [[Dar es Salaam]] | hq_location_country = [[Tanzania]] | area_served = | key_people = Adam Wamunza(CEO) | products = | brands = | services = | owner = | ratio = | rating = | website = {{URL|http://www.nicoltz.com/|Company website}} }} '''National Investments Company Limited (NICOL) Tanzania''' is a [[Tanzanian]] investments company headquartered in [[Dar es Salaam]]. It was incorporated in June 2003 as National Investments Company (NICO). In 2007 the company renamed itself as the National Investments Company Limited (NICOL). The company was one of the first few companies to be listed on the [[Dar es Salaam Stock Exchange]] in 2004. The majority of the company's investment portfolio is in securities, however, it also owns two active subsidiaries.{{Cite web|url=http://www.nicoltz.com/about_us.php|title=NICOL {{!}} National Investment Company Limited|website=www.nicoltz.com|access-date=2018-06-01}} == History == === Public listing === The company listed on the [[Dar es Salaam Stock Exchange]] all of its 1.6 billion shares at [[Tanzanian shilling|TSh ]]{{shilingi|400}} per share, on 15 July 2008.{{Cite news|url=https://www.african-markets.com/en/stock-markets/dse/tanzania-nicol-applies-for-dse-relisting|title=Tanzania: NICOL Applies for DSE Relisting |last=Elinaza |first=Abduel |work=AFRICAN MARKETS|access-date=2018-06-01|language=en-gb}} In 2011 the Capital markets authority forced them to de-list as they had not provided financials for 2009, 2010 and engaged in a sale of assets that was not in accordance to the law.{{Cite news|url=http://www.thecitizen.co.tz/News/1840340-4122732-4egni3z/index.html|title=Tanzania’s delisted Nicol announces financial statement with|date=2017-10-03|work=The Citizen|access-date=2018-06-01|language=en}} At the time of de-listing the company shares were trading for {{shilingi|270}}. However, in 2017 the company re-surfaced and declared its first divided of {{shilingi|25}} per share after 10 years of operations. After the dividend declaration, the company announced its plan for re-listing on 6 June 2018 at {{shilingi|300}} per share.{{Cite news|url=http://www.thecitizen.co.tz/News/Nicol-declares-dividend-payment-for-first-time/1840340-4212074-p731p8/index.html|title=Nicol declares dividend payment for first time|date=2017-12-03|work=The Citizen|access-date=2018-06-01|language=en}} == Corporate affairs == === Business trends === The key trends for NICOL over recent years are shown below (as at year ending 31 December): {| class="wikitable" style="margin:1em auto;" |- style="text-align:center;" ! style="background: #1268B3;" | ! style="background: #1268B3;" | 2010 ! style="background: #1268B3;" | 2011 ! style="background: #1268B3;" | 2012 ! style="background: #1268B3;" | 2013 ! style="background: #1268B3;" | 2014 ! style="background: #1268B3;" | 2015 ! style="background: #1268B3;" | 2016 ! style="background: #1268B3;" | 2017 ! style="background: #1268B3;" | 2018 |- | Profit before Taxation (TSh billion) | align="center" |{{color|red|-2.5}} | align="center" |{{color|red|-1.4}} | align="center" |{{color|red|-0.3}} | align="center" |0.9 | align="center" |0.9 | align="center" |0.2 | align="center" |9.2 | align="center" |1.2 | align="center" |4.2 |- | Net Asset Value (TSh billion) | align="center" | 25.7 | align="center" | 32.3 | align="center" | 42.2 | align="center" | 95.5 | align="center" | 125 | align="center" | 95.3 | align="center" | 109 | align="center" | 107 | align="center" | 94 |- |- |Earning Per Share | align="center" |{{color|red|-60}} | align="center" |{{color|red|-30}} | align="center" |{{color|red|-4}} | align="center" |30 | align="center" |33 | align="center" |11 | align="center" |232 | align="center" |33 | align="center" |81 |- | ''Notes/sources'' | align="center" | {{cite web |title=Nicol Annual Report |url=http://nicoltz.com//Admin/News/files/documents//34-annual%20report_%20final_low%20res%20(003)-laHal.pdf}} | align="center" | | align="center" | | align="center" | | align="center" | | align="center" | | align="center" | | align="center" |{{cite web |title=Nicol Annual Report 2018|url=https://dse.co.tz/sites/default/files/National%20Investments%20PLC_Annual%20Report%202018.pdf}} | align="center" | |} ===Subsidiaries=== * '''Tanzania Meat Company Limited''' - The company was founded on 28 July 2008 through a partnership between NICOL and the government's National Ranching Company (NARCO), with NICOL owning 51% of the shares. The company operates an abattoir in [[Dodoma]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.tmc.co.tz|title=Welcome - Tanzania Meat Company Limited (TMC)|website=Tanzania Meat Company Limited (TMC)|language=en-US|access-date=2018-06-04}} == References == {{reflist}} [[Category:Financial services companies of Tanzania]]
contentMetadata.text: National Investments Company Limited (NICOL) Tanzania is a Tanzanian investments company headquartered in Dar es Salaam. It was incorporated in June 2003 as National Investments Company (NICO). In 2007 the company renamed itself as the National Investments Company Limited (NICOL). The company was one of the first few companies to be listed on the Dar es Salaam Stock Exchange in 2004. The majority of the company's investment portfolio is in securities, however, it also owns two active subsidiaries. The company listed on the Dar es Salaam Stock Exchange all of its 1.6 billion shares at TSh 400/= per share, on 15 July 2008. In 2011 the Capital markets authority forced them to de-list as they had not provided financials for 2009, 2010 and engaged in a sale of assets that was not in accordance to the law. At the time of de-listing the company shares were trading for 270/=. However, in 2017 the company re-surfaced and declared its first divided of 25/= per share after 10 years of operations. After the dividend declaration, the company announced its plan for re-listing on 6 June 2018 at 300/= per share. The key trends for NICOL over recent years are shown below (as at year ending 31 December): Tanzania Meat Company Limited - The company was founded on 28 July 2008 through a partnership between NICOL and the government's National Ranching Company (NARCO), with NICOL owning 51% of the shares. The company operates an abattoir in Dodoma. "NICOL | National Investment Company Limited". www.nicoltz.com. Retrieved 2018-06-01. Elinaza, Abduel. "Tanzania: NICOL Applies for DSE Relisting". AFRICAN MARKETS. Retrieved 2018-06-01. "Nicol Annual Report" (PDF). "Tanzania's delisted Nicol announces financial statement with". The Citizen. 2017-10-03. Retrieved 2018-06-01. "Nicol declares dividend payment for first time". The Citizen. 2017-12-03. Retrieved 2018-06-01. "Nicol Annual Report 2018" (PDF). "Welcome - Tanzania Meat Company Limited (TMC)". Tanzania Meat Company Limited (TMC). Retrieved 2018-06-04.

National Investments Company Limited (NICOL) Tanzania is a [[Tanzanian]] investments company headquartered in [[Dar es Salaam]]. It was incorporated in June 2003 as National Investments Company (NICO). In 2007 the company renamed itself as the National Investments Company Limited (NICOL). The company was one of the first few companies to be listed on the [[Dar es Salaam Stock Exchange]] in 2004. The majority of the company's investment portfolio is in securities, however, it also owns two active subsidiaries.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.nicoltz.com/about_us.php|title=NICOL {{!}} National Investment Company Limited|website=www.nicoltz.com|access-date=2018-06-01}}</ref>

texts.title: Public listing
texts.value:
The company listed on the [[Dar es Salaam Stock Exchange]] all of its 1.6 billion shares at [[Tanzanian shilling|TSh ]]{{shilingi|400}} per share, on 15 July 2008.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.african-markets.com/en/stock-markets/dse/tanzania-nicol-applies-for-dse-relisting|title=Tanzania: NICOL Applies for DSE Relisting |last=Elinaza |first=Abduel |work=AFRICAN MARKETS|access-date=2018-06-01|language=en-gb}}</ref><ref name="NA2016" /> In 2011 the Capital markets authority forced them to de-list as they had not provided financials for 2009, 2010 and engaged in a sale of assets that was not in accordance to the law.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.thecitizen.co.tz/News/1840340-4122732-4egni3z/index.html|title=Tanzania’s delisted Nicol announces financial statement with|date=2017-10-03|work=The Citizen|access-date=2018-06-01|language=en}}</ref> At the time of de-listing the company shares were trading for {{shilingi|270}}.

However, in 2017 the company re-surfaced and declared its first divided of {{shilingi|25}} per share after 10 years of operations. After the dividend declaration, the company announced its plan for re-listing on 6 June 2018 at {{shilingi|300}} per share.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.thecitizen.co.tz/News/Nicol-declares-dividend-payment-for-first-time/1840340-4212074-p731p8/index.html|title=Nicol declares dividend payment for first time|date=2017-12-03|work=The Citizen|access-date=2018-06-01|language=en}}</ref>

The company operates an abattoir in [[Dodoma]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.tmc.co.tz|title=Welcome - Tanzania Meat Company Limited (TMC)|website=Tanzania Meat Company Limited (TMC)|language=en-US|access-date=2018-06-04}}</ref>
